This is the [SiteDocClan] To-Do Wiki.
This serves as a database of those site maintenance tasks related to documentation.

Suggested task process:

  • Familiarize yourself with the items on this list.
  • Work off any items you can.
  • Add new items as needs are determined. See instructions below.
  • Edit the entry of an item if you discover important relevant information
  • If you start work on an item but don't finish right away (for example, it is a long-running task), edit the entry to say you are working on it. Put a date on such edits.
  • When you complete an item:
    1. Delete the item from this wiki.
    2. If appropriate, [SDC Wiki|notify the Clan] of the completion.
  • Whenever you need clarification on an item, or just want to bounce around some ideas, please do it on the [SDC Wiki] or in the [Inner Scriptorium], or even in the CB, but not here.

(Note: In times past, this wiki served different purposes. Let history be what it [id://786306|was]. :-)

New Entry Instructions

  • Add a new task entry at the bottom of the list.
  • Assign a unique ID number to the new entry. This should be one up from the previous entry.
  • Use the following template:
Number. Title

Description, etc.

2. Finish [id://786929] and update [id://396325]

[id://786929] pertains to [id://492690]. Finishing this requires a good understanding of how [Recently Active Threads] users styles and color gradients, and particularly how the different view modes (Minimal Nodes, Full Thread, Root and Node, Node Ancestors) use styles and gradients.

[id://396325] is the main [Recently Active Threads] documentation. It is in usable shape, but badly needs some editorial TLC.

3. Document standard page appearance/parts

We should have a faqlet explaining all the parts of a standard PerlMonks page. In particular, [jdporter|I] notice that we haven't documented the (what I'll call) "this node as" links line... by which I mean the line which appears as

( #237008=wiki: print w/ replies, xml )
for example. This list will have varying links depending on the type of node being displayed.

4. Update CUFP Docs

Now that all code sections other than [Cool Uses For Perl] have been deprecated (not counting the specialized ones - Poetry and Obfu), the site docs should be updated to say that [Cool Users For Perl|CUFP] is the place for code of all sizes - from one-liners (formerly the fodder of [Snippets Section|Snippets]) to full-blown apps and modules (the stuff of [Code Catacombs]). Docs to be updated include (but are not necessarily limited to):

  • [id://972]
  • [id://237057]
  • [Cool Uses for Perl sitedoclet]

5. Update [id://43037]

Per [tinita]'s reply to [koolgirl]'s [id://917661], at least the message related section of the "shortcuts" sitefaqlet need updating. I'm now playing with those I don't use regularly, to see what updates appear (empirically) to be needed; if a Monk with specific knowledge of the (partial) fixes towhich [tinita] referred elects to share that knowledge, I would be on more nearly solid ground. So far, my experiments suggest that the messagebox shortcuts either don't work exactly as advertised... or represent the long way around to open the [id://762476].
